page.title: 09Wildlife,Ashey area
page.content: Despite grant aid for farmers to pull up{hedgerows}we found only one example of this in our area. As well as the hedges there is some copse and other woodland so there are plenty of fairly safe habitats for rodents and other{mammals.}We saw rabbits on the North side of Ashey Down and we found evidence of mice and voles on the Downs and in the woodland areas. We saw a{Kestrel}on the Downs and were told of a{Barn Owl}nesting at Whitefield Farm. The cowman at West Ashey also told us that he had seen{foxes}on his farm but he thought they came from some distance away. This also seemed to be a good year for{pheasants}despite the fact that the old gamekeeper's cottage is empty so noone is looking after them any more.
